intro: Lacinaria halei, commonly known as the Hale's lacinaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Lacinaria halei thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
